snippet: A look at the evolution of Joseph Mitchell, the well-known journalist, and a fact-filled, nostalgic tribute to an abundant season for theater.
abstract: Sam Roberts reviews books Man in Profile: Joseph Mitchell of The New Yorker by Thomas Kunkel and The Great Parade: Broadway’s Astonishing, Never-to-Be-Forgotten 1963-1964 Season by Peter Filichia.
lead_paragraph: A look at the evolution of Joseph Mitchell, the well-known journalist, and a fact-filled, nostalgic tribute to an abundant season for theater.

headline.print_headline: A Portrait of a Prolific Profiler
headline.main: Books on Joseph Mitchell, the New Yorker Writer, and the 1963-64 Broadway Season
